name: Racoon Racket
description:
In Raccoon Racket the player takes the role of three raccoons precarious stacked on top of each other to dupe hapless campers out of their change. Manage the front office of the  campground over Canada Day long weekend directing campers, selling them supplies and hoarding those precious shiny coins. Raise enough money so you can get your tiny little hands on the biggest trash haul of all time. 

  • Jump between three different critters with their own talents to serve campers 
  • Race against time with increasingly more difficult requests
  • Keep your little critters in line from trying to steal snacks and attracting too much attention
  • And most importantly: Don’t let campers find out you’re a bunch of raccoons.

Keep your eyes on the prize and that garbage heap will be yours for the taking.

Raccoon Racket was developed by Game Jelly. We’re a group of developers gathered in Sudbury, ON. 

Mike Daoust (@theMikeDaoust)- Programming

Joel Boucher (@joelgb2194) - Level Design

André Sokolow (@7pawn) - Art

Nathaneal Martin (@WinglessWallaby) - Art

Collin Marando (@snippledizzle) - Music and Sound Design

Paul Ungar (@PaulUngar) - Other stuff

Instructions

Man (or racoon) the desk at the ranger desk and serve the various campers that come to you.  Each racoon has a various skillset whether it be serving the customers and pointing to directions, translating words to racoon-speak or grabbing items on the bottom shelf.

Mouse - Move hand around.

Left Click - Grab object / point

W / S - Move up/down to switch between racoons.

Requirements

Keyboard & Mouse (No gamepad support in initial release)
